intro: Cyathopus sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim cyathopus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, forested areas at high altitudes, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its small white or yellowish flowers are clustered in umbrella-like structures, and it produces small, round fruits. Cyathopus sikkimensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations in its alpine habitat.
